body_content.explanation: an electrical device that produces a stream of water under pressure, that you use in your mouth to remove pieces of food or plaque (= a substance containing bacteria that forms on teeth) from around and between your teeth :
examples: A water flosser can clean the spaces that brushing misses.
Some people use string floss first, to scrape and loosen plaque, followed by a water flosser to rinse out any residue.
